availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Brennan (Louisville, Kentucky, clerk; capt & maj 3rd Ky Inf USA)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Clerk in Louisville in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain and major from March 7, 1863, to October 13, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 191.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 170.
